intro: Eremogone insignis, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Eremogone insignis is often found in sandy soils and is a member of the Malvaceae family.
